venue: Green Center at Colorado School of Mines

films.title: Bee Wild
films.description: BEE WILD (55 min) is an inspirational, upbeat, and poetic documentary that explores the foundational role that bees play in sustaining humanity, the reasons for their sharp population decline and how we can regenerate bees worldwide so they are once again part of a thriving ecosystem.
films.producer: Josh Tickell, Rebecca Tickell, Eva Kruse, Regina K Scully, Susan Rockefeller, Melony Lewis, Adam Lewis

films.title: Binvasion
films.description: A mockumentary about recycling bins by a group of young people in Dumfries. A news crew investigate a story of a missing cat and uncover a new life-form!
films.cast: Anna Romanyuk, Annie Pickstock, Fraser Duncan

films.title: Build Better Futures
films.description: A group of at-risk students compete against college engineers to design a sustainable house in an inspiring story that calls for the transformation of the building industry.

films.title: Building on the Edge
films.description: A group of architecture students embark on an epic adventure when they set out to design and build a research station on one of the least hospitable places on the planet, Antarctica.

films.title: Catapults to Cameras
films.description: In Catapults to Cameras, Kolkata-born wildlife filmmaker Ashwika Kapur sets out on a deeply personal quest to uncover the roots of an illegal wildlife hunting festival in the forests of her home state West Bengal. The film follows the journey of five children who eventually become conservation ambassadors.

films.title: Chirp Talker
films.description: On her city balcony, Audrey delights in the flutter of tiny birds - fluffing their feathers, chattering, and sneaking tangerine bites. Their chirps sound like cheerful hellos and playful spats, inspiring her to invent a bird-language translator that unlocks their secret conversations.
films.producer: Esme Cheng Ying Liu, Chien-Ting Chen

films.title: Chopping Down More Than Trees: The Hidden Impacts of Deforestation
films.description: Our video covers the basic aspects of deforestation, and inspires viewers to make a change in our world. Including how and why it happens, why trees and forests are important for our economy, effects of deforestation on animals, how deforestation causes natural disasters, the solutions to deforestation, and how solutions have worked in some parts of the world.
films.director: Amelie Anderson, Helen Bierstadt, Eleanor Lovejoy, Liam Wilcox, Josephine Woodruff

films.title: From Sea to Shining Sea: Katharine Lee Bates and the Story of America the Beautiful
films.description: FROM SEA TO SHINING SEA: KATHARINE LEE BATES AND THE STORY OF AMERICA THE BEAUTIFUL examines the remarkable life of Katharine Lee Bates, poet, professor, and social reformer; an unsung hero best known for authoring America the Beautiful and who was deeply committed to the beauty and principles of our country.

films.title: Gringo Cofán
films.description: GRINGO COFÁN is an intimate portrait of Randy Borman's extraordinary life. Born in 1955 in the Ecuadorian Amazon and raised among the Cofán people, Randy was the son of American missionaries who grew up fully immersed in Cofán culture. The film offers a window into their life before the arrival of oil companies, and the devastating consequences of exploitation, pollution, loss of ancestral land.

films.title: Guardians of the Earth
films.description: In the wild heart of Kenya, ancient wisdom meets modern conservation in this powerful short documentary about indigenous protectors committed to saving Africa's remaining wildlife and wilderness. We meet the men who have dedicated themselves as rangers, Maasai lion guardians, and Samburu women whose ancestral beadwork carries the stories of their identity.

films.title: Guardians of Yellowstone, The Yellowstone Cougar Project
films.description: For over 35 years, a dedicated team of biologists has quietly shaped one of the most enduring and impactful wildlife research programs in America. Guardians of Yellowstone takes viewers deep into the wild heart of Yellowstone National Park to reveal the hidden lives of cougars as stealthy apex predators.
films.director: Max Freund, Andy Adkins, William Freund
films.producer: Max Freund, Andy Adkins, William Freund
films.cast: Dan Stahler, Kerry Murphy, Toni Ruth, Justin Duffy, F222 Nubs, Baby Nubs

films.title: The Girl and Her Piano
films.description: High in the remote highlands of Bhutan, 12-year-old pianist and narrator Hillary O'Sullivan traveled with a piano and a message. 'The Girl and Her Piano' is a poetic and urgent short documentary that follows her remarkable journey to 4,000 metres above sea level, where music becomes both witness and voice for a planet in crisis.

films.title: The HAWK WATCH Documentary
films.description: Endangered raptors. A dedicated crew of citizen scientists. A fragile desert environment. The HAWK WATCH Documentary follows local conservationists as they attempt to establish a legacy: protecting the Swainson's Hawk migration in Southern California.

films.title: The Human Side of Plastic: Abby Barrows
films.description: On Deer Isle, Maine, home to one of the world's most productive lobster ports, warming waters and invisible microplastic pollution threaten a centuries-old way of life. As veteran lobsterman, Joel Billings, and his daughter, Hannah, reckon with the possible end of their family's tradition, neighbor and microplastics researcher, Abby Barrows, offers a vision for a more sustainable future.
films.director: Andrew Lynch, Ben Ayers, Rush Sturges

films.title: The Invisible Mammal
films.description: Against the backdrop of the sixth mass extinction, an all-woman team of biologists set out to save bats from a deadly fungal disease. But when the COVID-19 pandemic interrupts their work, they are sent down a path of discovery that illuminates the connections between bat conservation and the spread of infectious disease.
films.producer: Kristin Tieche, Holly Mosher, Windy Borman, Matthew Podolsky

films.title: The Light Won't Dim
films.description: The Light Won't Dim is a 30-minute documentary exploring the promise and urgency of solar power in a time of climate crisis. From Puerto Rico's Centro Buen Pastor, where solar panels became a lifeline after Hurricane Maria, to New York City schools and small-town rooftops, the film shows how communities are taking energy into their own hands.
films.producer: Jackson Hyland-Lipski, Jamie Henn, Duncan Meisel, Deirdre Shelly
films.cast: Bernie Sanders, Bill McKibben, Widalys Torres, Jigar Shah, Sandy Nurse

films.title: The Little Things that Run the World
films.description: THE LITTLE THINGS THAT RUN THE WORLD introduces viewers to a diverse group of scientists, nature lovers, gardeners, farmers, and general bug enthusiasts in exploring the importance of flying insects amid rapid declines in their numbers. This most numerous group of animals on the planet by far - three quarters of all species - have also been called the 'glue of life' on Earth.

films.title: The Rewilders
films.description: The western world has long equated survival with conquering the wild. But now more than ever, humanity's survival depends upon co-existence with the wild. Exploring the restoration of iconic species like jaguar, elephant, bison and Pacific salmon, The Rewilders is an intimate, visually spectacular short documentary that tells the tale of pioneering conservationists on three continents.
films.producer: Louise Valgardson, Trish Neufeld, Kyle Gunther, John Ritchie
films.cast: Mark Angelo, Kristine Tompkins, Daniel Kinka, Sarah Tompkins, Isabelle Tompkins, Oswald Schmitz

films.title: The Voice of Plants
films.description: What if nature could speak, and we were finally ready to listen? In this thought-provoking 8-minute mockumentary, visionary scientist Astrid deciphers a hidden language of plants, uncovering a shocking truth that challenges humanity's place in the natural order.

films.title: CITIZEN RUTH: environmental warrior
films.description: This 96-year-old environmental warrior has the bruises to show from the battles she fought, and the passion to carry her through the losses and the successes. Called the Mother of Greenbelts, responsible for the Boulder height limit, and persistent defender of open space, Ruth Wright continues to fight for the environment while the rest of us benefit from her lifetime of work.

films.title: Corals' Last Stand
films.description: Perched on the edge of the continental shelf, 300km from the Australian mainland lies Scott Reef. This half hour documentary asks whether Australia can really afford to exploit this gas reserve, examining the unique marine ecosystem and the threats posed by industrial development to one of the world's most pristine coral reef systems.

films.title: Doesn't Exist in Nature
films.description: In this episode of the popular docu-series 'Doesn't Exist in Nature', naturalist-host Douglas Nottenborough travels the world in search of a non-native, invasive species of Straw. A satirical mockumentary exploring environmental themes through humor.

films.title: An Eye for the Land
films.description: A documentary exploring the connection between people and land, examining how we see, understand, and protect our natural landscapes.

films.title: Fish for the Future
films.description: Multiple agencies and volunteers come together after the Palisades Fire in Los Angeles, CA to rescue an endangered fish population before they are threatened to be completely wiped out by an upcoming mudslide.

films.title: Fly Chicks
films.description: Fly Chicks explores the practice of fly fishing through a feminist lens. The film follows three fly fisherwomen and their relationship with the river and its inhabitants, the sport, and their identities.

films.title: Free to Grow
films.description: Rural Oregon families have taken up the fight against aerial herbicide spraying by the forestry industry for over 50 years. This documentary chronicles their ongoing battle for environmental justice and the right to protect their communities from toxic chemical exposure.

films.title: From Flames to Change
films.description: How is climate change affecting our future? The 2020 wildfires in Colorado are a reminder of the hurt to come if we don't stop and take a look around. This documentary explores the connection between climate change and increasingly destructive wildfires.

films.title: Global Warning
films.description: A documentary examining the urgent realities of climate change and its global impact on communities, ecosystems, and our shared future.

films.title: Hoʻomalu ʻĀina Maui
films.description: A documentary exploring the deep connection between the Hawaiian people and their land on Maui, examining traditional stewardship practices and the fight to protect sacred natural places.

films.title: Homes for Hornbills
films.description: A wildlife conservation documentary following efforts to protect and provide habitat for endangered hornbill species, examining the critical role these birds play in forest ecosystems.

films.title: Journey Beyond The Grid
films.description: A documentary exploring life off the electrical grid, following individuals and communities who have chosen sustainable, self-sufficient lifestyles and the challenges and rewards of disconnecting from conventional power systems.

films.title: Legion 44
films.description: A documentary following the 44th Legion firefighting crew and their heroic efforts battling wildfires, examining the human cost of increasingly severe fire seasons driven by climate change.

films.title: Marine Field Station
films.description: A documentary taking viewers inside a marine research station where scientists study ocean ecosystems, marine life, and the impacts of climate change on our seas.

films.title: Nature. People. Harmony.
films.description: A documentary exploring the essential balance between human civilization and the natural world, featuring stories of communities working to live in harmony with their environment.

films.title: Oceanbone
films.description: A documentary exploring ocean health and marine ecosystems, examining the vital role oceans play in sustaining life on Earth and the threats they face from human activity and climate change.

films.title: OUTLIER: Common
films.description: A documentary exploring environmental themes through the lens of what we consider 'common' in nature, examining how overlooked species and ecosystems are essential to our planet's health.

films.title: Outside The Frame
films.description: A documentary examining environmental issues from unexpected perspectives, challenging viewers to look beyond the obvious and see the interconnected nature of our ecological challenges.

films.title: Project Deer: Bridging Roads & Wildlife
films.description: A documentary examining innovative solutions to reduce wildlife-vehicle collisions, following efforts to create wildlife crossings that allow deer and other animals to safely navigate human infrastructure.

films.title: Regenerative Ag in the Northern Great Plains
films.description: A documentary exploring regenerative agriculture practices in the Northern Great Plains, showcasing farmers and ranchers who are restoring soil health, sequestering carbon, and building resilient food systems.

films.title: Save the Farm, Save the Future
films.description: A documentary about the fight to preserve family farms and sustainable agriculture in the face of industrial farming, urban sprawl, and climate change.

films.title: Shaped by Ice
films.description: A documentary exploring how glaciers and ice have shaped our planet's landscapes, ecosystems, and human civilizations, while examining the rapid disappearance of ice in a warming world.

films.title: Snk'mip Dig Deeper
films.description: A documentary following indigenous-led environmental efforts, exploring traditional ecological knowledge and the fight to protect ancestral lands and waters.

films.title: SPILLOVER - Planet of Viruses
films.description: A documentary examining the connection between environmental destruction, habitat loss, and the emergence of zoonotic diseases that spill over from wildlife to humans.

films.title: Stone Biter: Saving the Arctic Sea Forests
films.description: A documentary about efforts to protect Arctic kelp forests, the vital marine ecosystems threatened by climate change, and the scientists working to save them.

films.title: Tipping Points are Irreversible
films.description: A documentary exploring climate tipping points - the critical thresholds beyond which changes become irreversible, and the urgent need to act before we cross them.

films.title: Trade Secret
films.description: A documentary investigating the hidden environmental costs of global trade, exposing how trade agreements and corporate practices impact communities and ecosystems around the world.

films.title: Transitions
films.description: A documentary exploring the transition from fossil fuels to renewable energy, following communities, industries, and individuals navigating the shift to a sustainable future.

films.title: Upstream, Downriver: Uniting for Water Justice
films.description: A documentary about communities along rivers fighting for clean water, examining the connections between upstream actions and downstream impacts, and the movements for environmental water justice.

films.title: Valley Under Fire
films.description: A documentary chronicling the devastating wildfires that swept through a valley community, exploring resilience, recovery, and the increasing threat of extreme fire events in a changing climate.

films.title: We Are Made from the Land
films.description: A documentary exploring the deep spiritual and cultural connection between indigenous peoples and their ancestral lands, and the fight to protect these sacred places.

films.title: We Can't See the Sunset
films.description: A documentary examining the effects of air pollution and environmental degradation, exploring communities where smog and haze have made clear skies a distant memory.

films.title: What The River Knows
films.description: A documentary exploring the wisdom held by rivers - the stories of the communities along their banks, the ecosystems they support, and the lessons they teach about living in balance with nature.

films.title: Women of Carbon
films.description: A documentary following women leaders in climate science and carbon reduction efforts, highlighting their innovative work to address the climate crisis and inspire the next generation of environmental advocates.

venues.name: Bunker Auditorium
venues.location: Colorado School of Mines, Golden, CO

venues.name: Lookout Mountain Theater
venues.location: Colorado School of Mines, Golden, CO

venues.name: CEFF Theater
venues.location: Colorado School of Mines, Golden, CO

CEFF Opening Night Reception + Film Screening
